<root><template><title>Command</title><part><name>Comments</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> ofpr </value></part><part><name>Game name</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.85</value></part><part><name>Game version</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Strings </value></part><part><name>GROUP1</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Define a comment. 

Mainly used in [[SQF_syntax|SQF Syntax]], as you're able to introduce comment lines with semicolons in a [[sqs syntax|SQS script]].<br>
<template lineStart="1"><title>warning</title><part><name index="1"/><value>This command is evaluated during execution, and as such is infinitely slower than other SQF comment methods (//comment or /*comment*/; which do not exist at runtime). See [[SQF_syntax|SQF Syntax]] for additional documentation on comments.</value></part></template> </value></part><part><name>DESCRIPTION</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> '''comment''' commentMsg </value></part><part><name>SYNTAX</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> commentMsg: [[String]] - the comment that you'd like to write here </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER1</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Nothing]] </value></part><part><name>RETURNVALUE</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________
		  
</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> script.sqs <code>[[comment]] "This is a commented line"</code> </value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE1</name>=<value>
</value></part><part><name>x2</name>=<value> function.sqf <code>[[comment]] "This is a commented line";</code> </value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE2</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="6"/><value> [[Control Structures]] </value></part><part><name>SEEALSO</name>=<value>

</value></part></template>

<h3 style="display:none">Notes</h3>
<dl class="command_description">
<comment><!-- Note Section BEGIN -->
</comment>
<dd class="notedate">Posted on September 12, 2009 - 19:50
<dt class="note">[[User:Tom_48_97|Tom_48_97]]<dd class="note">Like ArmA, you can't use brackets to make a multi-lines comment. But, in a sqf file, you can make a comment as follow :
<code>[[comment]] "
 first line
 seconde line";</code>


<comment><!-- Note Section END -->
</comment></dl>

<h3 style="display:none">Bottom Section</h3>

<comment><!-- CONTINUE Notes -->
</comment><dl class="command_description">
<dd class="notedate">Posted on November 4, 2016 - 16:17 (UTC)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:Tofof|Tofof]]</dt>
<dd class="note">

If a file is loaded with [[preprocessFile]], [[execVM]] or [[spawn]] (but not [[loadFile]]), you may also define C-like comments using <tt>// ...</tt> and <tt>/*...*/</tt>.

</dd>
</dl>
<comment><!-- DISCONTINUE Notes -->
</comment>
<comment><!-- CONTINUE Notes -->
</comment><dl class="command_description">
<dd class="notedate">Posted on November 4, 2016 - 20:46 (UTC)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:Revo|Revo]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
'''comment''' can also be used to create comments inside trigger activation fields where <tt>//</tt> or <tt>/*...*/</tt> don't work.
</dd>
</dl>
<comment><!-- DISCONTINUE Notes --></comment></root>
